column1: # Features CSV Template
## Instructions for Creating Features CSV
1. **Feature Identification**: Assign unique IDs to each feature (F001
2. **Clear Naming**: Use descriptive
3. **Detailed Descriptions**: Provide enough detail for understanding without being verbose
4. **Priority Setting**: Use High/Medium/Low based on business value and dependencies
5. **Status Tracking**: Use consistent status values (Not Started
6. **Epic Grouping**: Group related features under common epics
7. **Story Point Estimation**: Use consistent estimation scale (Fibonacci: 1
8. **Assignee Management**: Assign features to specific team members
9. **Date Planning**: Set realistic start and due dates based on dependencies
10. **Dependency Mapping**: Clearly identify feature dependencies
11. **Acceptance Criteria**: Use Gherkin format (Given/When/Then) for clear
- Example: "Given I am an unauthenticated user
column2: When I submit valid credentials to the login form
column3: Then I should be redirected to the dashboard"

column1: 12. **TDD Section Link**: Link to specific Technical Design Document sections for implementation context
13. **Sprint Assignment**: Assign features to specific sprints (e.g.
14. **Risk Level**: Assess risk as High/Medium/Low based on complexity and dependencies
15. **Business Value Score**: Rate business value on 1-10 scale (10 = highest value)
16. **Technical Debt Impact**: Assess technical debt impact as High/Medium/Low
17. **Feature Flag**: Specify feature flag name or N/A if not using feature flags
18. **A/B Test ID**: Assign A/B test identifier if feature will be tested
19. **Revenue Impact**: Estimate revenue impact in $ or percentage
20. **User Segment**: Define target user segment (e.g.
21. **Master Index Update**: If cascade=true in development-guide.md
column2: update master-index.md when features are added

column1: 22. **Notes Section**: Use for additional context
Feature ID
